page.title: 02MUNDON AND THE BLACKWATER.
page.content: -THE CLIMATE- In Summer one of the warmest parts of England is Essex. In Winter it is much colder than Ireland and the West.The region is drier than the North and the West having less than 750mm's of rain. Mundon is low-lying land bordering the Blackwater Estuary. The Estuary stays mostly at the same temperature so Mundon is inclined to be dry. Often when nearby areas are suffering from storms and floods the Mundon area is hardly affected. In June this year crops in some parts of Essex were ruined by hailstones the size of golf balls. At the same time Maldon and Heybridge suffered bad flooding but the two farms in Mundon had only moderate rainfall. The highest rainfall is in January closely followed by September. by Hamish Turpin. 1B2
